intro: Brassica flexicaulis, commonly known as the curled cabbage, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its tightly rolled, cabbage-like leaves that form a dense, compact head. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in cool climates. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
